definition: each sticks to his own version (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: Experts and former officials are divided over the impact.
sentences.chinese: 專家和前官員對此次公開密件的影響各執一詞。

sentences.english: European press coverage is marked by telling differences of vocabulary.
sentences.chinese: 而歐盟的媒體也是各執一詞。

definition: to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
to concentrate on the main points (idiom); to bring out the essentials
